feed.title: Example Blog
feed.subtitle: A blog about programming and technology

entry.title: Getting Started with Rust
entry.summary: An introduction to the Rust programming language, covering ownership, borrowing, and lifetimes.
entry.content:
Rust is a systems programming language that runs blazingly fast, prevents segfaults, and guarantees thread safety.

In this post, we will explore the core concepts that make Rust unique among modern programming languages.

entry.title: Understanding XML Parsing
entry.summary: Deep dive into XML parsing techniques including DOM, SAX, and pull parsing approaches.
entry.content:
XML parsing is a fundamental operation in many software systems. There are several approaches to parsing XML, each with its own trade-offs.

DOM parsers build an in-memory tree representation, SAX parsers emit events, and pull parsers let the consumer drive the process.

entry.title: Memory Safety in Systems Programming
entry.summary: Exploring how modern languages approach memory safety without garbage collection overhead.
entry.content: Memory safety bugs are one of the most common sources of security vulnerabilities. Languages like Rust, Swift, and modern C++ offer different approaches to preventing these issues at compile time.

entry.title: Building High-Performance Parsers
entry.summary: Techniques for building parsers that can process gigabytes of data per second.
entry.content:
Parser performance matters when processing large datasets. Techniques like SIMD-accelerated scanning, arena allocation, and string interning can dramatically improve throughput.

This post examines real-world benchmarks comparing different parser architectures and the performance characteristics of each approach.

entry.title: The State of XML in 2024
entry.summary: Despite JSON's popularity, XML remains crucial in enterprise systems, document processing, and configuration.
entry.content:
XML continues to be widely used across industries. From SOAP web services to office document formats (OOXML, ODF), from SVG graphics to Maven build files, XML is everywhere.

This post surveys the current XML ecosystem and discusses why having robust, secure XML parsing libraries remains important.
